CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Best performance of the bulk - heterojunction solar cells with a power conversion efficiency of 5.05% was achieved with PIDT-C12NT as donor and (6,6)-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as acceptor , which can be attributed to its higher charge carrier mobility , the optimized interpenetrating network as well as enhanced absorption coefficient of photoactive layer with respect to the other two polymers.

Let's think step by step.

1. PIDT-C12NT
2. (6,6)-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM)

These are the material names mentioned in the paragraph. PIDT-C12NT is a donor material, and PC71BM is an acceptor material used in the bulk-heterojunction solar cells.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. PIDT-C12NT
2. PC71BM

These are the relevant material names in the paragraph. The other terms like "donor" and "acceptor" are roles or properties of these materials, not the names of the materials themselves.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Best performance of the bulk - heterojunction solar cells with a power conversion efficiency of 5.05% was achieved with PIDT-C12NT as donor and (6,6)-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as acceptor , which can be attributed to its higher charge carrier mobility , the optimized interpenetrating network as well as enhanced absorption coefficient of photoactive layer with respect to the other two polymers.

Let's think step by step.

1. "power conversion efficiency" is a property name
2. "higher charge carrier mobility" is a property name
3. "optimized interpenetrating network" is a property name
4. "enhanced absorption coefficient" is a property name

These entities are properties that belong to the materials or structures being discussed in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. "power conversion efficiency" is a material property
2. "higher charge carrier mobility" is a material property
3. "optimized interpenetrating network" is a structural property
4. "enhanced absorption coefficient" is a material property

I have removed any entities that do not clearly refer to a material or structural property. The remaining entities are properties that describe the characteristics or performance of the materials or structures being discussed in the paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| power conversion efficiency |
| higher charge carrier mobility |
| optimized interpenetrating network |
| enhanced absorption coefficient |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Best performance of the bulk - heterojunction solar cells with a power conversion efficiency of 5.05% was achieved with PIDT-C12NT as donor and (6,6)-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as acceptor , which can be attributed to its higher charge carrier mobility , the optimized interpenetrating network as well as enhanced absorption coefficient of photoactive layer with respect to the other two polymers.

Let's think step by step.

1. "a power conversion efficiency of 5.05%" - This is the first "Property Value" entity in the paragraph. It refers to the efficiency of the solar cells in converting solar energy into electrical energy.
2. "its higher charge carrier mobility" - This is the second "Property Value" entity in the paragraph. It refers to the ability of the material to conduct charge or electricity.
3. "the optimized interpenetrating network" - This is the third "Property Value" entity in the paragraph. It refers to the arrangement of the donor and acceptor materials in the solar cell, which can affect the efficiency of the device.
4. "enhanced absorption coefficient of photoactive layer" - This is the fourth "Property Value" entity in the paragraph. It refers to the ability of the photoactive layer to absorb light, which is an important factor in the performance of solar cells.
5. "with respect to the other two polymers" - This is a relative "Property Value" entity in the paragraph. It compares the properties of the materials mentioned earlier with those of other polymers.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. "a power conversion efficiency of 5.05%" - This is a Value of Material Property, as it refers to the efficiency of the solar cells in converting solar energy into electrical energy.
2. "its higher charge carrier mobility" - This is a Value of Material Property, as it refers to the ability of the material to conduct charge or electricity.
3. "the optimized interpenetrating network" - This is not a Value of Material Property, as it refers to the arrangement of the donor and acceptor materials in the solar cell, rather than a specific property of the material.
4. "enhanced absorption coefficient of photoactive layer" - This is a Value of Material Property, as it refers to the ability of the photoactive layer to absorb light, which is an important factor in the performance of solar cells.
5. "with respect to the other two polymers" - This is not a Value of Material Property, as it is a relative comparison between the properties of the materials mentioned earlier and those of other polymers.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| a power conversion efficiency of 5.05% |
| its higher charge carrier mobility |
| the optimized interpenetrating network |
| enhanced absorption coefficient of photoactive layer |

Note: I have included "the optimized interpenetrating network" in the table as it is still relevant to the discussion of the properties of the materials, even though it is not a specific property of the material itself. However, if you would like me to exclude it, please let me know.
